New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team since Golden State in 2015-16 to win 13 straight to start a season.
Cleveland Cavaliers tied their franchise record of 13 straight wins set three previous times — in 2009, 2010 and 2017.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell had 23 points, 14 rebounds, and nine assists in the Cavaliers’ 114-106 win over Philadelphia.
Darius Garland led Cleveland with 25 points in their win.
Rookie first-round pick Jared McCain scored a career-high 34 points for Philadelphia.
Donovan Mitchell scored 11 points in the final three minutes, closing the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Donovan Mitchell emphasized the importance of staying grounded despite the winning streak.
Darius Garland mentioned the need to clean up certain aspects of their game despite the wins.
Coach Kenny Atkinson acknowledged the pressure of maintaining the winning streak and praised the team's maturity and humility.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia played without key players Joel Embiid, Paul George, Tyrese Maxey, and Andre Drummond due to injuries and illness.
Cleveland's success has been attributed to ball movement and scoring, with six players averaging double figures in scoring.
